result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Martyr Sincyr Myers

defendant.name: Myers, Martyr Sincyr

records.addlTxt: Signed by SRN on 11/1/22 approving fees totaling $422.50. jaf             C: KS & Coll Clerk. jaf
filed by Atty Anderson totaling $422.50. sf
filed by Atty Timothy Anderson totaling $422.50. sf

2:13 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Martyr Sincyr Myers in court.  Attorney Timothy Dale Anderson in court for Martyr Sincyr Myers.  Prosecuting attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CM358 & 22TR1579. Atty Anderson states there is an agreement to DJOC on Ct 1 in 22CM358, 22TR1579 is dismissed.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1- Possession of THC in 22CM358.  DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 22CM358, Court signs off on DJOC, withholds entry of judgment of conviction in favor of DJOC for one year.  On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses 22TR1579.  Court questions DE on monthly payment plan.  DE states he has payment for October.  Diversion staff to update the Court quarterly, at 9 month mark, state may offer an early discharge.  Adjourned at 2:25 PM. bph

The original document was titled: Compas
The original history event date is: 09-15-2022
Compas

records.addlTxt: Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.
